oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Serum enzymes in bovine practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rich, L. J.
Dunavant, M. L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: blood chemistry
cattle diseases
Diagnosis
enzymes
Serum
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The measurement of many serum enzymes can aid the veterinary clinician in making accurate diagnoses and predicting the outcome of disease. However, to use these aids properly, the clinician must know what units and how the enzyme values are reported and some basic pathophysiology so that enzyme values can be correctly interpreted. The determinations of enzymes are here to stay; in fact, new, low cost, simplified kits are beingcommercially prepared at a rapid rate.
